description:
VP of Business Development

Our client is an Information Technology consulting firm with 10+ years combined experience in federal, commercial and Health IT needs. This individual will be responsible for cultivating business opportunities within the Federal Government by identifying, developing, leading, and managing client relations with key Federal Government agencies in the Washington DC area.

Opportunity: Direct Hire

Compensation: $160,000-200,000 + bonuses/commission (OTE $300,000+)

Schedule: Monday-Friday (8-5)

Location: Washington, DC (REMOTE)

Responsibilities:
• Lead the Federal Government Business Team by taking an active role in the development of personnel
• Assist the Managing Principal and Director of Operations in determining the personnel needs for the Government Business Team and individual projects based upon the current and projected workload
• Work with Project Managers in evaluating scope, complexity, and scheduling requirements of projects.
• Validate work planning strategies to ensure successful project execution
• Establishes long-term, highly visible partnerships with companies and other organizations that add value to LAD. Supports business-to-business development.
• Informs and educates senior leadership about business development opportunities
• Use established relationships with key members/decision makers with various Federal purchasing agencies to set up meetings with LAD senior leadership
• Identify leads for upcoming opportunities with appropriate Federal Government agencies
• Develop and position the firm for responding to appropriate government solicitations
• Evaluation and go/no go process for solicitations for AE services
• Actively pursue relationships with partnering firms in pursuit of federal business opportunities; these may include large or small businesses as well as design or construction firms

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s in Architecture/Engineering and professional registration, preferred
• Minimum of 15 years mid to large size A/E firm experience.
• Strong Washington DC beltway contacts in the Federal Sector
• Strong ability to communicate and coordinate actions within the office across geographical locations
• Excellent client management, customer service orientation, and writing and presentation skills.
• Deltek Vision proficiency a plus

Category Code: JN019
